title: Two UGA assistants receive raises
text:
Two UGA assistants receive raises A pair of Georgia coaches have received pay raises, according to a report. Slot to Georgia Links 
A pair of Georgia assistants will be receiving pay raises. 
Per Seth Emerson at the Atlanta Journal-Constitution, running backs coach Dell McGee will receive a $75,000 raise, bumping his pay to $350,000. McGee just finished his first season at Georgia and signed one of the nation's top tailback prospects in D'Andre Swift. He signed Elijah Holyfield and Brian Herrien in the 2016 cycle after coming on board in January 2016. McGee will coach Nick Chubb and Sony Michel for their senior season and is trying to sign five-star Zamir White in the 2018 class. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) 
Scott Sinclair, the strength and conditioning coordinator at Georgia, will receive a $80,000 raise, bringing his annual salary to $300,000, per the report. The report also confirms new defensive line coach Tray Scott will make $400,000.
